0.name: The Hole
desc: "   Mogue spends most of his time here working out construction plans
and sketching new designs.  This place is a mess!! Paper thrown around
the room, pencils, paper, batteries, erasers, and fragments of bitten
and chewed pen caps roll around the floor.
An exit exists to another dimension.  It is clear that this is a secret
and hidden room by the one-way mirror trap door in ceiling.  Mogue wants
it that way so he will get it that way.
A sign says "IMMORTALS and GUESTS Only!!" - Die Rebel Scum...perhaps
a reference ... is scrawled in blood, scratched into the ceiling.
This room has properties typical of the immortal arena.

1.name: The Bog
desc: "   It is quiet here.  There is no breeze and the silence of the area is
extraordinary.  The ground seems soft, almost hollow.  There is evidence
of traffic here, perhaps something or someone has worked their way
through the muck -n- mire, but it seems it all ends here.  Frilly bits
of old man beard hang from the trees, the area is mostly dark and grey
and is absent any life

6.name: The Clearing
desc: "   The trees open up to a bright sky here.  The surroundings unlike
the bogs and switchbacks here seems more friendly.  Moss covered
rocks glisten in the light and there is a few scrubs of bushes
keeping the soils and grounds soft and congenial.

7.name: The Clearing
desc: "   Open air and bright surroundings make the clearing a more
hospitable environment than the previous walk through bogs and
mountainous switchbacks.  It is almost as serene as a park with
flora and fauna underscored by the rocks, mosses, and glistening
sand.

8.name: The Clearing
desc: "   Open air and bright surroundings make the clearing a more
hospitable environment than the previous walk through bogs and
mountainous switchbacks.  It is almost as serene as a park with
flora and fauna underscored by the rocks, mosses, and glistening
sand.

9.name: The Westerly Switchback
desc: "   The jagged rocky hillside descends into a canyon.  Razor sharp rock
pokes out from each of the larger rocks on the slope.  The path is worn
and rocky, and barely passable.  Dirt and sand coat some of the rock
making this hill slippery. Large amounts of anthrocite, granite, and
some marble is visible within the veins of the aging surfaces.

17.name: The Easterly Switchback
desc: "   The rise up from the Canyon and the path below are full of sharp and
jagged edged rocks with properties similar to that of a razor blade.
Despite the path being worn and passable, certain danger lurks around
every turn.  Finite amounts of silver, or a metallic looking substance
run a course through the solid rock formations, but is not obtainable
because of the dangers of falling.

23.name: The Easterly Switchback
desc: "   The path ahead is perilous!  Dangers lurk at the mountainous path and
first glance, sharp rock with properties similar to that of razors
line the switchback.  Above this point there is a serene looking road
that has been traveled and looks worn.  Grasses line the top of the hill
unlike the terrain ahead.

24.name: The Golden Path
desc: "   Here the path takes on a colored hue of shiny gold as the light streams
through the trees and creates an aura of divinity.  Shadows are limited
as the light bends through the walk way and onto the golden straw
grass that grows on the path.  Stones cut to almost perfect shape and
size line the path, however shows signs of a lack of maintenance and
is slightly overgrown.

25.name: The Golden Path
desc: "   Here the path takes on a colored hue of shiny gold as the light streams

27.name: The Golden Path
desc: "   This path meanders through a cavalcade of overgrown straw and
cut stones that are near perfect in every way.  A golden hue of shiny gold
is apparent as the angle of the light shines down from above and blossoms
through the trees.  In this place there is a sense of brilliance and divinity
in an otherwise common part of the forest.  Flora and fauna abound as
it is a serene place for all of the gentle creatures that roam in this
land.

32.name: BradelHause Lane
desc: "   This road is made of cobblestone and limestone.  It is full of weeds
and grasses and does not appear to have been maintained in a very long
time.  There does seem to be some evidence of travel as the foliage
appears matted and brushed.  Under a dirt layer there is signs of the
old road as intended by the craftsman.  The area just seems abandoned.

33.name: BradelHause Lane
desc: "   This road is made of cobblestone and limestone.  It is full of weeds
and grasses and does not appear to have been maintained in a very long
time.  There does seem to be some evidence of travel as the foliage
appears matted and brushed.  Under a dirt layer there is signs of the
old road as intended by the craftsman.  The area just seems abandoned.

34.name: Western Gate on BradelHause Lane
desc: "   A large gate is here.  It is wide open, and any sign of a locking
mechanism is not apparent.  The left side is falling off its hinge,
while the right side appears to have knocked in by the blunt force
of a heavy object, perhaps a battering ram.  The weather elements have
left the gate further battered, and show the age of the gate.  There
is some iron relics of bars still left intact on the gate, but whatever
this gate was intended, it purpose is no longer served.

extra.desc: The gate is bashed in on one side - it is destroyed!

35.name: BradelHause Lane
desc: "   This road is made of cobblestone and limestone.  It is full of weeds
and grasses and does not appear to have been maintained in a very long
time.  There does seem to be some evidence of travel as the foliage
appears matted and brushed.  Under a dirt layer there is signs of the
old road as intended by the craftsman.  There is a small guardpost
to the north.

36.name: BradelHause Lane
desc: Inside the gate the path continues into the city limits. Weeds, grasses,
and sagebrush occupy the streetside and present evidence that this
city is not maintained or inhabited by a civilization.  The road continues
both directions, west heading outside the safety of the walls of the
city.

37.name: BradelHause Lane
desc: "   This road is made of cobblestone and limestone.  It is full of weeds

time.  There does seem to be some evidence of travel as the foliage
appears matted and brushed.  Under a dirt layer there is signs of the
old road as intended by the craftsman.  The area just seems abandoned.

38.name: Intersection at BradelHause and Blorde
desc: "   Two paths intersect here.  They both look abandoned and unmaintained, yet
are still passable.  Evidence of the original road exist under a layer
of dirt and dust denoted by some cobble and limestone sections still
exposed by the wind and rain, and weather elements.  Towering high into the
sky toward the north east is a large glass tower, that is amazing in both
size and shape.

39.name: BradelHause Lane

43.name: Inside the Eastern Gate on BradelHause Lane
desc: "   There is a large gate,locked,with a solid brass chain. The gate
appears weather-beaten and worn.  Chained to the large handle appears
to be a lock made of solid ore and has fresh key scratches in the
keyhole and on it's surface.  There is a giant glass tower that screams
high into the skyline toward the north west.

44.name: South Blorde Ave
desc: "   The lane ahead and behind is weathered and tattered.  There are plants,
and weeds that are growing out of the road that appears to have been
made of cobble stones and limestone.  A layer of dirt and mud allow
the foliage to continue to grow.  Although passable, it appears that
this road has been abandoned some time ago.  Some evidence does suggest
that this road has been traveled as the plants appear matted and
brushed.

45.name: Mogue's Arena
desc: "   The Crowd Chants..."Only 1 shall leave"....
.       Run. . .
.            Run. . .
.                  Run. . .

46.name: Mogue's Arena
desc: "   The Crowd Chants..."Only 1 shall leave"....

48.name: Daana's Weapon Repair Shoppe
desc: "   There is a large desk, locked, with a solid brass lock.  The desk
appears to have an anvil iron on top which is used for repairing metal
objects. In the corner there is a lathe. The lathe is used to repair wooden
based objects. There is a large grinding stone that seems to be used for
shaping stone, crystal, and other related items. There is furnace of some sort
that must be used for heating glass, and various other metals.

49.name: The South Gate at Blorde
desc: "   There is a large gate,locked,with a solid brass chain.  The gate
appears weather-beaten and worn.  Chained to the large handle appears
to be a lock made of solid ore and has fresh key scratches in the
keyhole and on it's surface.

extra.desc: The gate is solid and strong - it is chained.

50.name: North Blorde Ave
desc: "   The lane ahead and behind is weathered and tattered.  There are plants,

53.name: North Blorde Ave
desc: "   As the lane continues ahead, above the road here is a glass like
structure that looks like a bridge.  On the Eastern side of the road
is a tall crystalline tower structure that is glowing with a blue
aura.  Although passable, it appears the road has been abandoned.  High
above your head is a bridge that crosses over the street that looks
to connect into a tall glass tower, which is due east.

54.name: North Blorde Ave
desc: "   The lane ahead and behind is weathered and tattered.  There are plants,

this road has been abandoned some time ago.  Some evidence does suggest

55.name: Intersection at Blorde and Murchin Place
desc: "   Two main pathways intersect here.  It looks like the northern
route is blocked and does not allow any further progress.
There is a road that runs to the east and west, and appears
passable.  Small stones line the road and there doesn't
appear to have much time left before it is completely overgrown
with weeds and vines.  An enormous glass tower hovers high above the
city skyline toward the south east.

56.name: Murchin Place East
desc: "   Near the south-eastern corner of this large city, the glass tower
is protected by a large wall that runs along the northern side of the
street, and it looks as if the high wall on the south side protects the
city from the outside world. Blorde street is almost visible to the
west, and continues east along the city perimeter.

57.name: Murchin Place East
desc: "   Cobblestones and weeds, and weeds, and weeds, this road hasn't been
used for much of anything apparently for years. A high wall surrounds
a glass tower that climbs very high into the sky on the north side of
the street, while an even larger wall surrounds the city toward the
south, which appears to be a perimeter wall for the giant glass tower
soaring high above the city.

58.name: Murchin Place East
desc: "   The road runs east and west.  Cobble and lime stone edge the main
pathway that is big enough for a large group to walk without
discomfort.  The street doesn't appear to be clean and has weeds
and vines growing up into it, creating more cracks and crevices
than could be fixed easily.  The road appears abandoned, however there
is some kind of health center to the north.

59.name: Murchin Place East
desc: "   Close to the south-west corner of this small city, the road
is lined with giant walls that tower high above the road. On the north
side of the street is a giant wall that surrounds the base of a giant
glass tower, and on the southern side of the street is a large wall
that protects the city.

60.name: Murchin Place East
desc: "   Near the south-western corner of the city, walls surround the
remarkable glass tower that extends very high into sky, and is
visible from every inch of the city.  The road is not in very good
shape and is filled with tall grasses and weeds. The cobblestones are
broken and disconnected as years of growth has had its way with the
path.

61.name: Intersection at Murchin Place and Plandade
desc: "   There are two main paths that intersect here at what looks to be
a large common area.  On the eastern corner is a large Row house
that looks to have once served as living quarters for a large
group.  While the road appears abandoned and neglected, there
does seem to be a well worn path to the west and down to the
southern part of the town.  There is a tall glass tower visible
toward the south-west corner of the city.

62.name: Murchin Place West
desc: "   The road runs east and west.  Cobble and lime stone edge the main
pathway that is big enough for a large group to walk without
discomfort.  The street doesn't appear to be clean and has weeds
and vines growing up into it, creating more cracks and crevices
than could be fixed easily. The road appears abandoned.

63.name: Murchin Place West
desc: "   The road runs east and west.  Cobble and lime stone edge the main
pathway that is big enough for a large group to walk without
discomfort.  The street doesn't appear to be clean and has weeds
and vines growing up into it, creating more cracks and crevices
than could be fixed easily. The road appears abandoned.

66.name: Murchin Place West
desc: "   A large patch of dirt blocks the way further to the west.
The road runs only to the east.  Cobble and lime stone edge the main
pathway that is big enough for a large group to walk without
discomfort.  The street doesn't appear to be clean and has weeds
and vines growing up into it, creating more cracks and crevices
than could be fixed easily.  The road appears abandoned.

67.name: Plandade Road
desc: "   Close, near the south-west corner of the city where Bradelhause
lane comes together with Plandade, there are giant walls on both the
right and left sides of the street. To the north west is a glass
tower that reaches very high in the sky.  Its looks as if way up
top are birds or something that circle around the tower, but it is
rather high it is not quite clear what exactly is flying up there.

68.name: Plandade Road
desc: "   Extending further away from Bradelhause lane, the walls continue
to tower over the street. On the western side, a large wall protects
the base of a glass tower which extends very high up into the sky. On
the easterly side is a large wall that extends from the easterly gates
and heading north to south.

69.name: Plandade Road
desc: "   The road carries straight and true along the easterly side of
this city. Walls tower over the road, on the western side a wall that
protects a gigantic glass tower as high as the eye can see.

70.name: Plandade Road
desc: "   Extending further away from Murchin Place the road looks battered
and worn.  There are small holes that look like once had a stone in
place, and is nowhere in sight.  Gravel based, the road appears to
have once been made of limestone and cobble.  It appears abandoned
and does not have the craftsmanship that apparently was once
intended.

71.name: Plandade Road
desc: "   This path offers a decent view of the gigantic glass tower that
is in the center of this small city.  There are walls that surround this
tower on the west side of the road, while a large wall surrounds the
city along the easterly side.  The tower rises high above the city and
is easy to spot looking toward the south-west.
The structure is made of crystal and extends extremely high into the sky.

72.name: Plandade Row House
desc: "   A tall structure called a Row house is here impressing on the road
and appears to be in bad shape.  Old wooden claps fall partially
off the front of the building while some of the windows that
may have once kept out the elements have since fallen.  Grass and weed
grown in between the cracks of the rocky pathway and have taken over.

73.name: Inside the Plandade Row House
desc: "   The Row House is a quiet and peaceful.  In better times this house may
have been used as a place to slumber but the only bedding here is
tattered and moth ridden.  The walls appear drab and do not have
any type of decor, and have peeling paper mesh that looks like it was
recently added.

74.name: Plandade Row House
desc: "   A tall structure called a Row house is here impressing on the road
and appears to be in bad shape.  Old wooden claps fall partially
off the front of the building while some of the windows that
may have once kept out the elements have since fallen.  Grass and weed
grown in between the cracks of the rocky pathway and have taken over.

75.name: Plandade Row House
desc: "   A tall structure called a Row house is here impressing on the road
and appears to be in bad shape.  Old wooden claps fall partially
off the front of the building while some of the windows that
may have once kept out the elements have since fallen.  Grass and weed
grown in between the cracks of the rocky pathway and have taken over.

76.name: Inside the Plandade Row House
desc: "   The inside of the Row house is no longer beautiful and kept.  There are
holes in the wall, the ceiling is falling in, and there are cracks in
the floor big enough to fall through.  Weather has certainly helped
destroy what was left of the inside of this large room, but there are
signs of struggle, axe marks in the sills, and scrapes and stains
coat the surfaces.

77.name: Inside the Plandade Row House
desc: "   Poor lighting and drab decor do not indicate that this Row house
is habitable.  Signs of torture and bloodletting are centerstage in
this part of the house.  Some of the stains appear to be fresh kill
and have the stench of death.  The most apparent markings are
burned into the floor and have a triangle design.  Some old candles
are left behind. Sacrifice seems plausible, but who?

78.name: Palmeiro's Things Shop
desc: "   Litter and debris on the floor are matched equally by stains and
scars of a vicious battle that has left the owner of this shop trapped
and kept under very close supervision.  Seeing locks, chains, and other
entrapment devices offer a clue that this human is being held prisoner
of sorts, perhaps being studied, but why!

79.name: Guard Hut - West Gate
desc: "   The house is small and dank.  Quite fitting for an outpost.  Small
bits of broken twigs, leaves, and other debris line the floor.  The walls
are cracked and there are no windows.  Flys buzz about and in the corners
of the small building are spider webs.  The roof has some small holes
as the light exposes itself from the inside.

extra.desc: The roof has holes in it. Fitting for a guard...really!

80.name: Cragmeer's Rock
desc: "   A rock lies here with the word "Cragmeer" scrawled into it looking very
old.  Nothing else is here.  The rock is 20 decim by 400 decim and looks
to weigh about 2 tons.  The rock itself is not naturally placed and appears
to have been dropped here by an unrecognizable force.  There is a humming
sound coming from above and a glimpse of a bold glass tower can be seen
from here.  There is something unusual about this rock - it just seems out
of place.
The rock is mighty big. "Cragmeer" is scratched into the surface.
Who was Cragmeer anyway!!

extra.desc: The tower is made of glass *blue aura* - and is humming

81.name: Redbourn's Rags
desc: "   Rags, Tags, and Bags - the sign reads. This looks like a store, but
the merchant doesn't seem present. A counter is here, with shelving, and
the floor looks kept. The walls are strewn with designs that are not
recognizable, but reminiscent of the architecture found in ancient lands
very many years ago. There is a humming sound emanating from the outer
wall.

extra.desc: 'Rags, Tags, and Bags - we gottem'
The shelves are empty and bare.

82.name: Dentruder's Den
desc: "   The den has some style but appears unkempt.  Inside this room are carpets
made with a thick shag.  The pile is faily even with look of fresh cut
lawn, or streaks in it that are very intriguing.  The walls of the den are
also coated in carpet, and the pile is also very even.  Greenish brown colors
most of the room.

extra.desc: The carpets are thick shag - greenish brown color. They look fairly clean.
The carpets are thick shag - greenish brown color. They look fairly clean.

83.name: Dentruder's Den
desc: "   The den is more quiet here than in other places.  This room is warmer
and is cleaner than its other parts.  In here - the walls are not carpet,
instead, they are dark-stained wood with a very fine grain.  This room
smells new, and does not have the stale musty odor of an abandoned
building.  There is a humming sound coming from above.

extra.desc: Fine wood coats the walls and floors - and has a very clean look.
its hard to tell what is up there

84.name: Dentruder's Den
desc: "   The den has some style but appears unkempt.  Inside this room are carpets
made with a thick shag.  The pile is faily even with look of fresh cut
lawn, or streaks in it that are very intriguing.  The walls of the den are
also coated in carpet, and the pile is also very even.  Greenish brown colors
most of the room.

extra.desc: The carpets are thick shag - greenish brown color. They look fairly clean.
The carpets are thick shag - greenish brown color. They look fairly clean.

85.name: Dentruder's Den
desc: "   The den is quite remarkable.  A ruined city in all places, but a clean
room is here with walls made of fine ivory, and floors made of marbled
stone.  The ceiling is tiled with an ornate black glass that has no
reflection.  There is a tunnel to east that extends over North Blord
Avenue.  It is possible to see a large glass tower that towers over
the roadway and city beneath.

extra.desc: The tower is made of glass *blue aura* - and is humming loudly.
The floor is covered with marble tiles- black and white.

86.name: Bridge Over Blorde
desc: "   The bridge that crosses Blorde Ave is made of glass.  It seems safe enough
as the beams that support the walls are in good shape with no visible
wood rot.  There is a glass like Tower towards overshadowing the city below
and above rising high above the skyline.

extra.desc: The street below is North Blorde Ave. You have a good vantage point.
The tower rises high into the sky. It appears to have a blue glow.

87.name: Foray into the Glass
desc: "   This is the end of the bridge.  Everything is made of glass here.
There is a strong humming sound coming from all around.  The glass shimmers
and vibrates loudly.  The color of this glass is unlike anything ever described
before.  It is a smoky bluish green with a bright yellow hue.  Strangely there does
not seem to be a reflection in any of the glass despite it's shiny exterior. There
appears to be some kind of hidden glass that might allow entrance to the tower.
The glass is vibrating loudly. Trickles of yellow seem to flow between the pane
yet is not affecting the smoky bluish green coloring seen during first glance.

88.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   Above and into the sky towers a large, crystalline structure made of
blue and green smoky glass, with yellow streams of color in between
the panes.  It extends up toward the sky and there doesn't appear to
be any floors except at the bottom of the tower.  A curious trapdoor
is on the floor below your feet.  There seems to be some shouting or
perhaps a scream.

extra.desc: an old trap door
The trapdoor in the floor looks a bit precarious.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

89.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   The tower continues into the sky with magical energies and a loud
humming sound grows even louder as you rise up.  Etchings into the glass
depict scrolls, and writings of a very ancient civilization.  The walls
are smooth with the blue and green smoky glass, and as the tower extends
into the sky, shades of yellow turn into a more purplish hue.  The city is
below with a 360 degree view all around.

extra.desc: An excellent view from here provides a panoramic view of the landscape below.
Written in a divine language 'Ursupea Volmutas Adelanea'

90.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   Up, Up...Up into the tower higher and higher into the sky offers
a complete panoramic view of the city below.  Gradually the walls shift
colors from a purplish hue to a enlighten golden color mixed between
the panes of smoky blue and green glass.  The loud humming sound grows
more intense at this elevation.  There doesn't seem to be a floor or ceiling
in mid-air.

extra.desc: The color shifts from purple into gold...

desc: The forests are green and lush and extend in all directions surrounding
the city.

91.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   In mid-air...don't look down - or up! The vertigo challenged is
offered a chance to float in this divine and magical place.  Walls continue
to extend up into the air, and down, down below.  The walls remain a golden
hue flowing in between the panes of the smoky blue-green glass.  More carvings
are seen here etched into the wall etched into the glass.  Ancient letters or
characters are written out in long hand, extending up and down in both
directions.

extra.keywords: wall walls etching panes ancient letters characters
extra.desc: Written in a divine language 'Ursurpusara Neetala Vorgenomine Kelaek'

92.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   Floating above the world, the views are tremendous.  Flying high above
this city in this magical tower is a brief but unique experience only
offered to those who are willing to accept great risks.  The sound of the
humming seems to grow even louder as the tower gets higher.  The walls
slightly vibrate and cause the glass to shimmer.  The golden hue inside
the smoky blue-green glass changes again to offer a subtle tangerine
orange hue.

93.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   Up high in the air - this tower offers tremendous views of the
surrounding city and forests.  The floor and ceiling do not exist
within the smoky blue-green frame.  The humming sound, although loud,
is growing louder nearer to the top of this crystalline structure.
Etchings are marked on the wall and depict ancient writings in a
divine language.

extra.desc: Written in a divine language 'Ursurpela Viiueguer Yueilal'...

desc: The view from here is tremendous and overlooks the lands as far
as the eye can see.

94.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   Nearest the top of the tower now - the humming sound grows increasingly
louder.  The smoky blue-green glass gives way to a crystal-like bricking,
similiar to that of a honeycomb, but made of glass.  There is a shift
in the colors that are visibile, changing from an orange tint to a very
light vanilla color, and the walls - although transparent - seem to
vibrate loudly.  More etchings are visible written in a divine language.

95.name: Inside the Trap
desc: "   The entrance to the prison is not a comfortable place.  It doesn't
appear to have a way out - perhaps that this is the one place the wizards
of the tower put their victims.  The walls have scratches etched in blood,
and there are a few sticks, bones, rocks, and some assorted torture cuffs,
chains, and an empty feeling of loneliness.  The entrance to the prison
appears to be closed and locked.

96.name: Terberthia Tower
desc: "   At the top - finally the moment 'de triumph' atop the city's largest
structure.  A dome gives a panoramic view of the city around the
this crystalline structure.  The walls appear translucent, shimmering,
and humming very loudly here.  There is a vibration in the air, and
can be felt coming from the chamber to the east.  There is a slight
pungent odor that is somewhat disturbing.
City of Terberthia 6249.48....| ####### |
oooo |oHo|  ####AAAA######  | | ##XX### |x%x%WWx%%/ox||ooDoo |_     |xGGx|

97.name: Floating in the Glass
desc: "   Atop the structure is this bridge that is made of translucent glass
and has an odor that is not recognizable, is slightly stale, warm, and
a bit pungent.  The walls are a little difficult now to see as there
is some organic growth, not mold, but almost a sticky substance.  Here the
humming is much louder and there is a large system of pockets embedded
on the walls.  This room doesn't seem normal - it is out of place in
the tower.

98.name: Floating in the Glass
desc: "   Atop the structure is this bridge that is made of translucent glass
and has an odor that is not recognizable, is slightly stale, warm, and
a bit pungent.  The walls are a little difficult now to see as there
is some organic growth, not mold, but almost a sticky substance.  Here the
humming is much louder and there is a large system of pockets embedded
on the walls.  This room doesn't seem normal - it is out of place in
the tower.

99.name: The Hive
desc: "   The humming sounds are coming from LARGE Wasps! RUN RUN RUN!!  They
are all over the place, crawling, flying, and waiting for their next meal!
Coated in a gooey sticky slimy mess is a sign, perhaps hastily placed
by someone, or something, to warn future travelers.  There is a larger hole
towards the top of the room, but you have to wonder would it be a good
idea to go deeper in the hive.
If you have time to read this warning:
The wizards have abandoned the tower and the town was over-run by
these awful, aggressive insects. We put up a good fight, but in the
end we are forced to leave our beautiful city behind in hope of finding
a safer place. Beware this city! - Do NOT stay here - or you will be
suffered a fate worse than you can imagine!
A GOOEY Sticky Mess - the nest is not somewhere to linger...

100.name: The Hive
desc: "   The hive is a colony - the King and Queen rule and the rest of
the workers are made to serve them.  The humming sounds have grown louder
and the smell of this place is not like anything you have
ever come across before - but it is sweet smelling - and good so you have
to wonder how such a pleasant place can be filled with such terrible
events.  There is a sign etched in a rock as well, a look at the wall reveals
the true design of the hive.
careful - these nasties are not pleasant to deal with and will cause
severe pain to the unprepared. You have been warned. - Sylas Wrank (Master Wizard)

101.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony.  The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin.  All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

102.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony.  The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin.  All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

108.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony.  The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin.  All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

109.name: The Queen
desc: "   Here she sits in all her glory.  Her workmanship is discerning.  The
room is warm and stick, smells sweet.  The core of the hive, protected
by its outer layers, keeps the Queen and her subjects well protected.
Choosing the mage's tower as a new home drove the population of this
once highly decorated city of Terberthia away.  The Queen and her drones
now completely own this city, and everyone - and everything in it!  A dark
passage is over on the east wall.  A picture of her evilness is depicted
on a sketching on the wall.

110.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!
110.flags: dark, no_mob, no_sum, private, fall, dispel_magic

111.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

112.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

desc: "   It is too dark to see!

117.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

118.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

119.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   *CRASH* - You land in a pile of wood and debris which helps to
cushion the fall, and so this time, the impact does not kill you.  The
wasps must have built this tunnel to provide entrance or egress from
the hive high in the tower above you.  The air is damp and there is the
smell of rotted meat that is the putrid odor in the air.

120.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

121.name: Under the Ground
desc: "   It looks like someone started to tunnel under that big gate
but why?  Was there a reason to get out of the city that it required
a tunnel under a locked gate? This room is dank, wet, and full of the
most hideous smell that has ever occurred. The bottom of this pit seems
to be a good place for rats and mice to find as a good home, and it looks
as if there is a hole high above on the west wall that is too high to
reach.

122.name: Dark Tunnel
desc: "   It is too dark to see!

123.name: A Tunnel in the Hive
desc: "   The hive is constructed of a light material that is stick and has
a certain strength quality to it.  This tunnel leads away from the
center chamber in the hive. It has become a little warmer here and
the sweet scent is becoming a bit more potent.  It is hard to tell
whether the floor slopes up or slopes down.

124.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.  A
feeling of anxiety overcomes you.

125.name: A Tunnel in the Hive
desc: "   The hive is constructed of a light material that is stick and has
a certain strength quality to it.  This tunnel leads away from the
center chamber in the hive.  It has become a little warmer here and
the sweet scent is becoming a bit more potent.  It is hard to tell
whether the floor slopes up or slopes down.

126.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.  The
air here is really potent.

127.name: A Tunnel in the Hive
desc: "   The hive is constructed of a light material that is stick and has
a certain strength quality to it.  This tunnel leads away from the
center chamber in the hive. It has become a little warmer here and
the sweet scent is becoming a bit more potent.  It is hard to tell
whether the floor slopes up or slopes down

128.name: Terberthia Bank of a Nation
desc: "   Well, it is not the most safe looking place and appears pretty battered
and in quite disarray.  There seems to be an electronic device that allows
monetary transactions to take place.  However, the person in charge of
this facility doesn't appear to happy - and has a chain around their neck
keeping them locked in!  Why is the human here being kept as a prisoner is
hard to say - but perhaps they will still do some business with you.

129.name: Ye Ole Armorsmith Repair Shop
desc: "   Something isn't right!  The room is in complete disarray while there
are chains and cuffs, locks, and items that indicate that the smithy
has been detained and locked down.  He is still performing some of his
duties, but looking about the room, you are distracted by the fact
that this human is being held captive, and against his will.
There is a small list of services available.

130.name: Before the Chamber of Sundown
desc: "   There sometimes comes a time in one's life that there are no other
options, and there is no point in going on.  Those that enter the
Chamber of The Sundown have admitted to themselves defeat.  All other
options have been considered, and there can be no other way.  The chamber
itself contains a deadly toxic gas that quickly and painlessly removes
the life giving air from the lungs and brings about a quick death.
The Queen has hoped this for you since your entrance into her realm and
finds it comforting to know that you are accepting defeat.
Only those that wish death upon themselves should enter the chamber.

131.name: Terberthia Health Services Center
desc: "   The room is in much need of repair.  There are leaks coming from the
ceiling, and cracks in the walls.  It is not a very pleasant place to
have healing and health services, but by the looks of it this human
has been held captive and is a prisoner, perhaps being studied for the
habits and routines that come with being a human.  Chains and locks,
cuffs, and other devices to keep this person trapped here are in and
about the room.

132.name: The Silver Passage
desc: "   There appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that
when closer to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings
and has a shiney texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to
be part of the tower that is still orignal and was not touched by the
workers of the colony.

133.name: The Terberthia Residence Inn
desc: "   From the look of things, this innkeeper seems a little bothered, and
the chain around her neck doesn't look like anything that is comfortable.
This human appears to be a hostage, and has no real way to escape, but
why is it like this?  There is a safe looking chamber that might make a
semi-comfortable resting spot.

134.name: The Prison
desc: "   The prison hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

135.name: The Prison
desc: "   The prison hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

136.name: The Prison
desc: "   The prison hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

137.name: The Hive
desc: "   Close quarters are part of the colony strategy. It allows the elders
to more easily protect their young.  The ultimate protection strategy
gives the Queen a sense of security knowing that she is has become a
favorite target by the humans of Terberthia, for which she and her
legion have conquered.  The mages of Terberthia have fled this glass
tower in favor of survival.  However, they have ultimately made a vow
to someday return to free their enslaved people and bring death and dishonor
to the Wasp colony.

138.name: The Prison
desc: "   The prison hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

139.name: The Prison
desc: "   The prison hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.  There appears to be a small trap in the
ceiling.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock
door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

140.name: A Prisoners Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side
of the otherwise thick stone wall.  The door is a hardened cell door
with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

153.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

154.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.

155.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over

156.name: The Hive
desc: "   The Terberthian monks struggled to maintain their grasp over the
the evil queen and her colony but they were too strong and over powered
them, and enslaved many of their people.  The mages fought hard and created
many ways to try to destroy the mighty Queen and her legion, but it is not
known what happened to these objects, and their lore.  Dripping acid burns
through parts of the floor but does not appear to have a source.  A strong
door to the south looks very much like a safe.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

157.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   At meal time, the King lies up the selection of inadequates, including
wasps and human prisoners.  The deep rooted evil is passed generation
to generation and the cycle may never be broken.  The surrounding
areas including the forests of Terberthia may someday serve to destroy
the mighty colony, and the evil Queen of the wasps.

158.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   A powerful mage named Cragmeer was overthrown in the last days of the
Mages rule in Terberthia.  He was sent to the prison and executed for
his crimes and anti-allegiance to the might Queen wasp.  His legacy lives
on in other ways.  Cragmeer was an experimentalist who garnered all the
strengths and powers of Mages of Terberthia.  It is said he has crafted
some of the tools the early mages used to fight the Queen's might army,
however it is not known what has become of these powerful items or even
what may still be left.  Cragmeer was avenged only one time in the late
part of the time of the whisperer, post the apocalyptic rule of the
Queen and her mighty army.

159.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   The room is dripping with the scent of the hive queen as her Wasp
Valkryrie stand idle - waiting to serve the queen in which ever capacity
she desires.  The guardians of the Queen serve only one purpose which
is to destroy any and all foe that come close to her or try to destroy
her reign.  The scent grows most potent here and the humming is at its
most loudest.  In the chamber, the Queen is protected and nothing will
stop her and her legion from maintaining absolute control over Terberthia.

160.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   Approaching the dawn and early age of the mighty Queen wasp army
was not a simple task.  The blood shed on the streets of Terberthia
was little as there are stories of what the queen does to her victims,
including complete reuse of the victim.  She has committed such unspeakable
acts against the citizens of Terberthia,  and the one legend that still
remains today is that the Mages will someday return and reclaim the
mighty glass tower.  In places around the city are some markers to the
original inhabitants of Terberthia, but the Queen has seen to carefully
erase most of the history, and existence of the city's former inhabitants.

161.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   Approaching in the dawn to fight the mighty Queen wasp army
was not a simple task.  The blood shed on the streets of Terberthia
was little as there are stories of what the queen does to her victims,
including complete reuse of the victim.  She has committed such unspeakable
acts against the citizens of Terberthia,  and the one legend that still
remains today is that the Mages will someday return and reclaim the
mighty glass tower.  In places around the city are some markers to the
original inhabitants of Terberthia, but the Queen has seen to carefully
erase most of the history, and existence of the city's former inhabitants.

162.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   The hollowed out head of a wasp is said to protect the wearer against
some of the exploits known to be used by the Queen and her servants.  We
will be back and when we come back, the Queen and her army will be
cast down back into the ground where they belong. - Cragmeer

163.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   The King is the Queen's most popular servant. The baddest and the
most bold of all the soldiers, he delivers to her regularly his services
which include helping create and distribute the wasp larvae.  He is most
feared by the colony because of his powerful nature, both physically and
his mental fortitude for destruction of his own kind.  Wasps show no fear
however when the King is near, respect is commanded.  The King is also the
oldest of all the wasps. He selectively destroys any wasp that could take
his power, and therefore all servants could face instant death should he
command it.

164.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   In Cragmeer's experiments - a new breed of soldier was borne, and
favored electrical weapons to destroy the Queen.  However when the tide
turned and the Mages of Terberthia could not defeat the Queen - she slowly
took control of many of the experiments and applied the technology to serve
her and her organic society.  The Mages were smart in many of their decisions
and may have left some secrets behind to help defeat the Queen's army.  It
is a known fact that the society and depth of intelligence of your typical
wasp is not very interesting.  Her might and fear keep the wasp society in
line and keep serving her until she decides to eat them.

165.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   The people fled as quick as possible as the bodies started falling
from up high.  The fragile exterior of the human is no match for the
mighty army commanded by the queen. With the power of flight alone, a
giant wasp can lift a human from the top of the tower to a height
greater than can be measured, and let them fall to meet their maker.
Our people are in hiding and they will find a way to defeat the
might Queen and her army.  Free the Slaves!  - Cragmeer

166.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: The walls are completely coated with a dripping goop that looks like
it could sting a bit if accidentally handled.  The Queen and her powerful
army have enslaved many of the former workers of the city to experiment
on them, study, and feast.  It is not known how many of the city's original
inhabitants are left here, maybe locked up, imprisoned, or left to suffer
as a reminder to others that the ruler here in this land has taken ownership
and will not show mercy to any human, or any being that is not a wasp, and
a member of her colony.

167.name: The Hive Queen Ante Chamber
desc: "   Further exploration of the glass tower may reveal other ways to
defeat the mighty queen.  Her legion of wasps are dangerously close
to over population, but they can be defeated.  Some of the tools
left behind by the Mages of Terberthia may have already been confiscated,
or worse destroyed, however it is completely unknown and the history
of this once beautiful city has been completely unwritten, and unrecorded.

168.name: Secret
desc: "   The honeycomb secret is dank, dark and quiet.  It looks hand-carved and does
not appear to have the familiar sticky ooze, and there is only a faint sound
of the humming that is otherwise very loud in other parts of the hive.  There
are some scraps on the floor, and a few small bones that might have been from a
small animal.  A small note lies at the feet of a dead, emaciated corpse in the corner
of the room.  It's skin is severely withered, with signs of multiple scars that
appear to have been caused in battle.
The note says 'I am Cragmeer.  I have tried to destroy the colony, but if
you are reading this note - I did not succeed.  I have spent my days locked
in hiding, waiting for my allies to transfer to this safe room, but it looks
as if they might be dead.  I have tried to tell as much of our story by
scribing on the walls of the ante-chamber, but this is where my story ends and
yours begins.  At all costs - you must destroy the colony, and the queen - do
not let them bring demise on Terberthia, our once powerful and great city of
magic. Do not let the mage traitors (Doldomus and Travestine) who has helped
the queen succeed in great power and who has betrayed the citizens of Terberthia
get away with their plans any longer. If you have found me - you will be safe here
but always look over your shoulder, and watch out for the evil awaiting you below.
Signed in the 7th day of the rising new moon,
Cragmeer.
PS - Our people are still captive in the prison at the base of this tower! Long Live
Terberthia!

169.name: The Queen's Valkryrie Guard Post
desc: "   The mightiest soldiers who protect the Queen, her guard, serve her
well and command the security of the Ante Chamber from this room.  It
is well known that the Queen's Valkryrie are evil and twisted inhabitants
of the wasp colony and very rarely are seen by any of the workers or
soldiers within the colony.

170.name: The Queen's Valkryrie Guard Post
desc: "   The mightiest soldiers who protect the Queen, her guard, serve her
well and command the security of the Ante Chamber from this room.  It
is well known that the Queen's Valkryrie are evil and twisted inhabitants
of the wasp colony and very rarely are seen by any of the workers or
soldiers within the colony.

171.name: The Silver Passage
desc: "   There appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that
when closer to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings
and has a shiney texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to
be part of the tower that is still orignal and was not touched by the
workers of the colony.

172.name: The Silver Passage
desc: "   The silver passage leads directly to a large silver door.  There
appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that when closer
to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings and has
a shiney texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to be part
of the tower that is still original and was not touched by the workers of
the colony.

173.name: Travestin's Abode
desc: "   The room's decor is fine, with silver trimmings and ornate jewels
inset in the creases of the walls.  Like a fine linen - the walls appear
to be folded in waves but made of pure silver.  Although this looks
like a pleasant place to lodge, the silver walls appear to do more
look nice, but are a way to confine the occupant and perhaps even further,
confine their magic.  This is a holding cell for a powerful mage.

174.name: The Golden Passage
desc: "   There appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that
when closer to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings
and has a shiny texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to
be part of the tower that is still original and was not touched by the
workers of the colony.

175.name: The Golden Passage
desc: "   There appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that
when closer to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings
and has a shiny texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to
be part of the tower that is still original and was not touched by the
workers of the colony.

176.name: The Golden Passage
desc: "   The golden passage leads directly to a large golden door.  There
appears to be less sticky ooze here in the passage than that when closer
to the hive.  The walls are finely ornate with silver linings and has
a shiny texture that reflects with a blue glow.  This appears to be part
of the tower that is still original and was not touched by the workers of
the colony.

177.name: Doldomus' Abode
desc: "   The room's decor is fine, with golden trimmings and ornate jewels
inset in the creases of the walls.  Like a fine linen - the walls appear
to be folded in waves but made of pure gold.  Although this looks
like a pleasant place to lodge, the golden walls appear to do more
look nice, but are a way to confine the occupant and perhaps even further,
confine their magic.  This is a holding cell for a powerful mage.

178.name: A King's Chamber of Treasures
desc: "   This chamber is made to hold several of the Wasp King's most favored
items, including his treasures, weapons, and loot from the conquests of
Terberthia by the colony.  It is known that occasionally he comes in here
and takes his treasures to use or otherwise plunder unsuspecting civilizations,
so it is not always guaranteed he will store his stuff here - but the Guardian
remains vigilant and keeps watch over the King's valuables very carefully.

179.name: The Eastern Gate of the City
desc: "   Bradelhause lane extends to the west into the city while the large
gate seperates the city from the forest.  The gate is made of large
forged metals and is strong, tall, and secure.  There is a giant lock
in the center of the gate handle that looks like it will open with a key
and allow entry or exit from the city or into the forest.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

180.name: Tufanda's Misery
desc: "   The silver passage also houses one of the more legendary, but
unloyal residents of Terberthia.  Tufanda the mage warrior was
responsible for betraying Cragmeer with the rest of the traitors and
brought the demise of Terberthia's former civilization upon the people.
Here is the home of the most creative and well liked mage, and his inventions
of weapons with magic were stolen by the queen by her colony and used to
destroy the mages of the tower.

181.name: Redbourn's Riches
desc: "   Within the golden passage the traitor has built himself a new
home with the support of the queen and her army.  At this time it appears
that the riches have been removed from the equation and Redbourne is left
with very little.  He almost looks enslaved.  As a traitor to the people
of Terberthia - there is little concern for the well being of this mage.

182.name: Terberthia Cemetery Entrance
desc: "   The large gates before you allows entrance to the Terberthia cemetery
where many of its former residents are buried or remembered.  There is a
large house that looks like it belongs to the undertaker and city mortician.
The gates are rarely opened and will only be accessed by the undertaker
when it is required.

183.name: The Undertaker of Terberthia
desc: "   A sign hangs 'Welcome to the Terberthia city morgue'. We are very
sorry for your loss and we wish you our sincerest condolences.  If
there is an opportunity for us to serve you, we would be more than happy.
If there is someone here - type 'list' and we will offer you our
available services.

184.name: Sanctum of Yyles
desc: "   The loud humming sound is coming from the south, but this santum
seems original to the glass tower, still showing its original blue and
green glass.  It is not as reflective as some of the other parts of the
tower but maintains some of its natural beauty.  Small containers look
to have once been held in an otherwise empty rack of holders.  A portion
of the room near the exit seems to have the familiar sticky ooze coming
through the floor.

185.name: The Eastern Wing
desc: "   Mysteriously the sound of the hive gets strangely quiet.  Here the
walls of glass turn back to the more familiar blue and green that
represents the true architecture of the tower.  Toward the west the sounds
get a bit louder, while down the opposite side of the corridor there is a
bit of light coming from an otherwise normal looking room.

186.name: Gosellel's Study
desc: "   The lights are on, the door was open, and the invitation to enter
seems to be extended.  The room is equipped with sewing and fabrication
devices that look to have been used for making trademark tools for the
mages of Terberthia.  Here in the study there isn't much, a simple desk,
a small chair, a lit candle, and some unusual parchments.

187.name: The West Wing
desc: "   Mysteriously the sound of the hive gets strangely quiet.  Here the
walls of glass turn back to the more familiar blue and green that
represents the true architecture of the tower.  Toward the east the
buzzing gets a bit louder, and there is a few drops of water on the floor
coming from the west.

188.name: Gosellel's Aquarium
desc: "   Suddenly water springs up from all around the corners of the room
and small fish float by.  The inside of the aquarium seems to magically
contain aquatic life and truly represents the magic and power of the
glass tower.

189.name: The Organic Passage
desc: A large sign at the top of the room hanging down...
-==== "WORK MAKE FREE" ====-

190.name: The Sleep Chamber
desc: "   You have found a safe place to lay your head, but is it really
safe, after all this room is practically destroyed by the elements, and
maybe something else. The inn seems like a reasonable place to at least
take a brief rest, but it looks like a real dump.  There is a sign here
that is worth looking at.
This is a sleep chamber and you can safely exit the game here by using
the 'rent' command.

191.name: The Slave Pit
desc: A Large Archway Entrance Reads:
"The queen welcomes you to your new life as her slave!"
The locked archway appears to lead somewhere....

192.name: The Slave Sale
desc: "   Before you stands a very large stage used for auctioning the captured
to the highest bidder.  It contains steel and iron restraints, large
stone blocks to which restraints are fastened, and a single podium for
the slaves to stand and recite incantations, speeches, and readings
from selected books.  The wasp queen is most interested in the intelligence
level of her slaves and to fetch a better and more respected owner, a captured
slave will do their best to show obedience and respect to the colony.
The stage is 900cm by 40de and is made of wood and some kind of
organic material.  Large chains lay dormant waiting for the next auction.

exits.info: door, closed, secret, knockable, autoclose, autolock

193.name: The Slave Prep Room (blue glow)
desc: "   With a large stage just off to the east, this room is reserved for
the few slaves to be prepared for auction.  They are scared and face
uncertainty toward the future, and could easily be killed or worse,
tortured while on stage as the wasp auctioneer shows his power and might
and EXPECTS to get a good price.  The entrance to the slave pens may be
able to be opened.
The room gives a feeling of comfort and safety....
A message is tacked to the wall.
Attention lock pickers and thieves, punks, and defilers!  An
increase in security has prompted us to put under heavy guard
our key to the prison and the pens.  We trusted that duty to
our Prison Warden. Anyone who thinks they should have access
to a locked door should take it up with him.

193.flags: no_mob, no_sum, private, fast_mana, fast_hit_points, fast_moves, relocate_distort

194.name: Below the Slave Pit
desc: "   Here the groans and cries of the captured are overheard, and the
those that are bound and shackled are just upward on a short ladder
to the Auctioneer's stage.  The room is coated in filth and muck lines
the floor from wall to wall.  In the corner there are broken splinters
of wood and busted chains are plenty.

195.name: A Slave Reception
desc: TIRED? --> NEED A REST?  -> GET A BREAK FROM YOUR SLAVE LIFE!
The slave traders keep their property close by but know that even
the captured, weak, and weary, need some place to rest.  The queen
doesn't approve of mercy, as she believes that is for the weak minded.
However some of the guards are short of patience and don't mind if the
slaves spend a little time here.  After all - no one is going anywhere.
195.flags: no_mob, peaceful, no_sum, no_magic, private, relocate_distort

196.name: The Slave Pen
desc: "   The pens hallway leads to several slave cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

197.name: The Slave Pen
desc: "   The slave pens are dark and damp, and do not have any comforts.  The
large stone walls are lined with iron and reinforced steel.  Scratches
on the walls perhaps show others trying to break free, or otherwise just
using last efforts to escape this dungeon.  There are lines of cells
attached to the pens.

198.name: The Slave Pen
desc: "   The pens hallway leads to several slave cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.

199.name: The Slave Pen
desc: "   The slave pens are dark and damp, and do not have any comforts.  The
large stone walls are lined with iron and reinforced steel.  Scratches
on the walls perhaps show others trying to break free, or otherwise just
using last efforts to escape this dungeon.  There are lines of cells
attached to the pens.

200.name: The Slave Pen
desc: "   The pens hallway leads to several prisoner cells, each with a
hardened steel door encased in stone, and its own lock.  The room is
only minimally lit and is dark, damp, and foreboding.  There are screams
and shouts coming from all over.  You can faintly hear sounds coming from
the other side of the cell door.   There is a marking on the wall.
Trapdoor
V

201.name: A Slave Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side
of the otherwise thick stone wall.  The door is a hardened cell door
with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

202.name: A Slave Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side
of the otherwise thick stone wall.  The door is a hardened cell door
with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

203.name: A Slave Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side

with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

204.name: A Slave Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side

with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

205.name: A Slave Cell
desc: "   A dark and grim room with scratches on the walls and stained floors,
and with only minimal light is used to house human prisoners.  The
room has no bed, or furniture, and consists only of a five by five
meter room with some water that drips out of a small pipe in the side

with a massive lock that looks impenetrable without the proper key.

206.name: The Hive
desc: "   A thin coating lines the walls and inside of the colony. The smell is
sweet and sticky.  The humming sound is loudest here and the food supply
looks thin. All around you in the hive is danger.  There is no sign of any
other life as it appears the wasp colony has completely taken over.
The room feels different...

207.name: A Tunnel in the Hive
desc: "      The hive is constructed of a light material that is stick and has
a certain strength quality to it.  This tunnel leads away from the
center chamber in the hive. It has become a little warmer here and
the sweet scent is becoming a bit more potent.  It is hard to tell
whether the floor slopes up or slopes down

208.name: Its Sundown for YOU!!
desc: GAS Fills your lungs!!!!
You GASP for air *choking* *choking* !!
All you see is . . . blackness.

209.name: MOB LOAD ROOM 209
209.desc: I am loading some mobs here to walk out into room 174

210.name: MOB LOAD ROOM 210
210.desc: I am loading some mobs here to walk out into room 150
